APP-PO-14142.Applies To:
Oracle Purchasing - Version 11.5.10 to 12.1 [Release 11.5 to 12.1]
Information in this document applies to any platform.
POXRQERQ.fmb
POXAPAPC.pll
APP-PO-14142.Symptoms:
1) Users are not able to submit requisitions in iProcurement (using AME) due to error :

"You do not have the authority to approve this requisition and an Approval List was not created automatically. Please contact your system administrator"

2) In Oracle Purchasing after clicking Approve in the Requisition form, the following error occurs:

APP-PO-14142: WF_Error-000: ORA-0000 normal, successful completion

Cause: A SQL error hass occurred in WF_Error. The SQL error is ORA:0000: normal, successful completion.

Action: Take note of both this error number and the actions you were trying to perform.
Contact your system administrator for further assistance.

Also, trace files show that this error is occuring:

ORA-20001: Oracle Approvals Management has found parallelization configuration details. The context in which ame_api has been invoked does not support parallelization

Note: In an additional case parallelization was done in the Oracle Human Resources module creating the error on requisition approval with 'POR_AME_APPROVAL_LIST_WF1S.Get_Next_Approver (Get_Next_Approver: 002- 787437-REQUISITION-PURCHASE, ORA-20001: Oracle Approvals Management has found parallelization configuration details'.
APP-PO-14142.Cause:
For release 11.5.10 or if not using parallelization in Release 12, AME configuration variables are not correctly setup.

If using parallelization in Release 12, the issue is caused in POXAPAPC.pll, when submitting the requisition for approval, we used to have the following call : ame_api.clearAllApprovals. This should be replaced by ame_api2.clearAllApprovals for Release 12 and onwards.
APP-PO-14142.Solution:
For all versions:
1. First confirm that the client is intentionally using AME. If they are not, see Note 470204.1.

For Release 11.5.10 / Release 12 and parallelization will not be used:
2. If AME is intentionally used:


1. Run @checkAME11510Setup.sql; and it will return numerous errors, such as:
Incorrect value for Transaction Type Configuration Variable
or
Non serial or Order Number Voting Regime for Approval Group : XYZ Approval group

2. Then run the following:

For more information on these scripts see Note 338508.1.
For Release 12 if parallelization will be used:
If AME is intentionally used:

1. Download and review the readme and pre-requisites for Patch:6956892

2. Ensure that you have taken a backup of your system before applying the recommended patch.

3. Apply the patch in a test environment.

4. Confirm the following file versions:
POXAPAPC.pld and version 120.11.12000000.7

You can use the commands like the following:
strings -a $AU_TOP/resource/POXAPAPC.pll | grep -i '$Header:'

5. Retest the issue.

6. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

For Release 12.1 :
If AME is intentionally used, this is fixed by file version POXAPAPC.pld 120.18.12010000.3 or higher:

1. Download and review the readme and pre-requisites for Patch 8352586:R12.PO.B

2. Ensure that you have taken a backup of your system before applying the recommended patch.

3. Apply the patch in a test environment.

4. Confirm the following file versions:
POXAPAPC.pld 120.18.12010000.4

You can use the commands like the following:
strings -a $AU_TOP/resource/POXAPAPC.pll | grep -i '$Header:'

5. Retest the issue.

6. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check if AME is intentionally used:
SELECT * FROM <Your_AME_Configuration_Table> WHERE <Your_Conditions>;
query2: For Release 11.5.10 or Release 12 without parallelization:
@checkAME11510Setup.sql;
-- Check for errors reported by the script and address them accordingly.
query3: For Release 12 with parallelization:
SELECT * FROM <Your_AME_File_Version_Table> WHERE <Your_Conditions>;
strings -a $AU_TOP/resource/POXAPAPC.pll | grep -i '$Header:'
-- Retest the issue and migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.
query4: For Release 12.1:
SELECT * FROM <Your_AME_File_Version_Table> WHERE <Your_Conditions>;
strings -a $AU_TOP/resource/POXAPAPC.pll | grep -i '$Header:'
-- Retest the issue and migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

FRM 40212.Applies To:
Oracle Purchasing - Version 11.5.10.2 to 12.2.4 [Release 11.5 to 12.2]
Information in this document applies to any platform.
FRM 40212.Symptoms:
On : 11.5.10.2 version, Purchase Order

When attempting to create Release from BPA,
the following error occurs.

ERROR:
FRM 40212 Invalid value for field PO_NUM

Steps to reporduce:
1. Create BPA and approve.
2. Provide effective dates.
3. Try to create Release. Error occurs.
FRM 40212.Cause:
Multiple causes are available for this issue. 


This is explained in the following bug:
Bug 5373119 : UNABLE ENTER EXPIRED BPA INTO POXPOERL FRM-40212 INVALID VALUE FOR PO_NUM
Bug 5108417 : RECEIVE INVALID VALUE FOR FIELD PO_NUM WHEN CREATING A NEW RELEASE FRM-40212
FRM 40212.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Verify whether this is Global BPA or Local BPA. If it is Global BPA Blanket Releases cannot be created. Only Standard Purchase Orders can be created.

or

2. Check the Effective Dates for the Blanket PO.
Query the Blanket PO in PO Summary and choose the OPEN button. 
Click the TERMS button and update the Effective Dates to date range within the current date. 

or


3. Check the Expiration Date for Blanket PO lines.
Query the Blanket PO and either provide valid Expiration_Date or remove Expiration_Date for BPA lines.

query1: Check if Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA) exists
SELECT * FROM po_headers_all WHERE segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>';
query2: Verify Effective Dates for the Blanket Purchase Order (BPA)
SELECT segment1, effective_start_date, effective_end_date FROM po_headers_all WHERE segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>';
query3: Check for Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA) Expiration Dates
SELECT bpa.segment1, bpal.line_id, bpal.expiration_date FROM po_bpa_lines_all bpal JOIN po_headers_all bpa ON bpal.po_header_id = bpa.po_header_id WHERE bpa.segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>';
query4: Verify Purchase Order (PO) Approval Status for the Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA)
SELECT segment1, approval_status FROM po_headers_all WHERE segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>';
query5: Check for Existing Releases for the Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA)
SELECT release_num, release_date FROM po_releases_all WHERE blanket_agreement_id = (SELECT po_header_id FROM po_headers_all WHERE segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>');
query6: Verify Purchase Order (PO) Summary for the Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA)
SELECT segment1, po_header_id FROM po_headers_all WHERE segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>';
query7: Check for Expired Blanket Purchase Agreement (BPA) Lines

SELECT bpa.segment1, bpal.line_id, bpal.expiration_date FROM po_bpa_lines_all bpal JOIN po_headers_all bpa ON bpal.po_header_id = bpa.po_header_id WHERE bpa.segment1 = '<BPA_NUMBER>' AND bpal.expiration_date < SYSDATE;

ORA-06510.Applies To:
Oracle Purchasing - Version 12.2.6 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
ORA-06510.Symptoms:
Program POXPDOI: Import Price Catalogs is in error with message in log



Error:
---Cause: FDPSTP failed due to ORA-06510: PL/SQL: unhandled user-defined exception
ORA-06512: at "APPS.PO_PDOI_GRP", line 398
ORA-06512: at line 1----



Steps to Reproduce the Issue
-----------------------------------

1. Login to a PO Responsibility with Setup Access (PO Superuser, etc)
2. populate PDOI (PO INTERFACE) tables with data as needed
3. launch the import price catalogs program
ORA-06510.Cause:
records in pdoi tables were in process
when these records set to rejected then data process
ORA-06510.Solution:
1. Set the records from IN PROCESS to REJECTED in PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE.

2. SQL>UPDATE PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE SET PROCESS_CODE = 'REJECTED'

3. Retry the Import Catalog Program

query1: Check records in PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE table that are in process
SELECT * FROM PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE WHERE PROCESS_CODE = 'IN PROCESS';
query2: Inspect the specific record causing the error in PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE
SELECT * FROM PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE WHERE PROCESS_CODE = 'IN PROCESS' AND ROWNUM = 1;
query3: Check for rejected records in PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE
SELECT * FROM PO_HEADERS_INTERFACE WHERE PROCESS_CODE = 'REJECTED';
query4: Review the error details in the log
SELECT LOG_TEXT FROM FND_LOG_MESSAGES WHERE LOG_SEQUENCE = (SELECT MAX(LOG_SEQUENCE) FROM FND_LOG_MESSAGES);
query5: Identify the package and line number where the error occurred
SELECT OBJECT_NAME, LINE FROM ALL_ERRORS WHERE NAME = 'PO_PDOI_GRP';
query6: Check for existing data related to the error
SELECT * FROM APPS.PO_PDOI_GRP WHERE ROWNUM = 1;
query7: Check the status of the Import Catalog Program
SELECT * FROM FND_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS WHERE REQUEST_NAME = 'POXPDOI' ORDER BY SUBMIT_DATE DESC;

ORA-01031.Applies To:
Oracle Purchasing - Version 12.2.8 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
ORA-01031.Symptoms:
E-Business Tax Issues

When attempting to submit a requisition for approval,
the following error occurs.

ERROR
-----------------------

Error Messages: Unexpected error occurred during Tax Calculation. Exception: 013 - ORA-0000: normal, successful completion. Please correct the problem or contact your System Administrator.


Additionally, the following error is captured in FND debug log:

ZX.PLSQL.ZX_TCM_PTP_PKG.GET_TAX_SUBSCRIBER.begin 2.00 .GET_TAX_SUBSCRIBER(-)
ZX.PLSQL.ZX_API_PUB.GET_DEFAULT_TAX_DET_ATTRIBS 6.00 ORA-01031: insufficient privileges
po.plsql.PO_TAX_INTERFACE_PVT.CALCULATE_TAX_REQUISITION.140 1.00 get_default_tax_det_attribs returned with status U


STEPS
-----------------------
The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:
1. Navigate to purchasing responsibility
2. Create an internal requisition
3. Submit IR for approval
ORA-01031.Cause: A custom package was changing the value of the context "MY_CXT". Sometimes, customer packages changes the context
ORA-01031.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. When the issue is happening, please run the following query to check the context:

select * from dba_context where namespace='MY_CTX';

Expect result of this query to have:

     PACKAGE = ZX_SECURITY
     SCHEMA = APPS

2. If the package returned is not as expected, run the following script to reset the context to resolve tax issue:

$ZX_TOP/patch/115/sql/zxitsctx.sql

3. Additionally, use the following query to examine the possible custom package returned in query of step 1 and make changes as needed to the custom package:

select object_name , owner,object_type , created
from dba_objects
where object_name = '&pkg_name';

select text from dba_source
where name = '&pkg_name';

4. Run the following query again:

select * from dba_context where namespace='MY_CTX';

Confirm result of this query to have:

     PACKAGE = ZX_SECURITY
     SCHEMA = APPS

5. Retest the issue. Tax should now calculate properly, and error ORA-01031: insufficient privileges no longer captured in FND debug

6. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check the context value during the issue
SELECT * FROM dba_context WHERE namespace = 'MY_CTX';
query2: Reset the context using the provided script
@$ZX_TOP/patch/115/sql/zxitsctx.sql
query3: Examine possible custom package returned in step 1
SELECT object_name, owner, object_type, created FROM dba_objects WHERE object_name = '&pkg_name';
SELECT text FROM dba_source WHERE name = '&pkg_name';
query4: Run the context query again to confirm the reset
SELECT * FROM dba_context WHERE namespace = 'MY_CTX';
query5: Retest the issue
Confirm that the tax calculation works properly, and the error ORA-01031: insufficient privileges is no longer captured in the FND debug log.
query6: Migrate the solution to other environments as needed.

ORA-01427.Applies To:

ORA-01427.Symptoms:
Updating Purchase Requisition Document Type ends with the below error, if the employee added to spot buy section, has more than one record in PER_ALL_PEOPLE_F table

ERROR
## Detail 0 ##
java.sql.SQLException: ORA-01427: single-row subquery returns more than one row

...
ORA-01427.Cause:
In PoDocTypeCategoriesVO,
 (SELECT FULL_NAME FROM PER_ALL_PEOPLE_F PER, FND_USER FU WHERE PER.PERSON_ID=FU.EMPLOYEE_ID
 AND FU.USER_ID=PoDocTypeCategoriesEO.USER_ID) EMPLOYEE_NAME

query1: Check the number of records in PER_ALL_PEOPLE_F for the affected employee
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM PER_ALL_PEOPLE_F WHERE PERSON_ID = (SELECT EMPLOYEE_ID FROM FND_USER WHERE USER_ID = :user_id);

SELECT USER_ID, (SELECT USER_NAME FROM FND_USER WHERE USER_ID = PO_DOC_TYPE_CATEGORIES.USER_ID) AS USER_NAME, (SELECT FULL_NAME FROM PER_ALL_PEOPLE_F PER, FND_USER FU WHERE PER.PERSON_ID = FU.EMPLOYEE_ID AND FU.USER_ID = PO_DOC_TYPE_CATEGORIES.USER_ID) AS EMPLOYEE_NAME FROM PO_DOC_TYPE_CATEGORIES WHERE DOCUMENT_TYPE_CODE = :document_type_code AND DOCUMENT_SUBTYPE = :document_subtype AND ORG_ID = :org_id;

ORA-20110.Applies To:
Oracle Purchasing - Version 12.1.3 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
ORA-20110.Symptoms:
On : 12.1.3 version, Approvals - Req, PO

When attempting to use multiple chains of authority while approving,
the following error occurs.

ERROR
-----------------------
The procedure getNextPosition could not find parent position for : HR Positions: XYZ
ORA-20110.Cause:
The issue is caused by the following setup:

No Rule is getting applied because wrong condition is being used. The Attribute is returning Y and/or N where as the condition is based on Yes and No.
 
Note:AME Rule will be applicable only if all the conditions are meet. In the above the attribute CMG_GCPO is returning Y where as you are checking Yes or No. Same with CMG_ARCHPO.

The condition is checking for {Yes} and {No} where as the SQL used in the attribute is returning 'Y' and 'N', so the condition is never being true. Hence it was not applying any rule, there by not generating any approvers. Making the PO auto approved.
ORA-20110.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Go into the responsibility: 'Approval Management Business Analyst'

2. Click on Setup Icon for 'Purchase Order Approval'

3. Update Attributes to make sure it returns value when the values are set to NULL



4. Add 4 new conditions:
  CMG_GCPO = Y
  CMG_GCPO = N

  CMG_ARCHPO = Y
  CMG_ARCHPO = N

5. Update the rules to use this above condition rather then {Yes} and {No}

6. Perform a Real-time transaction test

7. Retest the issue.

8. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check AME Rules and Attributes
SELECT * FROM fnd_ame_rules WHERE rule_name = 'YourRuleName';
query2: Verify Conditions and Values
SELECT * FROM fnd_ame_conditions WHERE rule_id = (SELECT rule_id FROM fnd_ame_rules WHERE rule_name = 'YourRuleName');
query3: Check Attribute Values
SELECT * FROM fnd_ame_values WHERE attribute_id IN (SELECT attribute_id FROM fnd_ame_attributes WHERE attribute_name IN ('CMG_GCPO', 'CMG_ARCHPO'));
query4: Inspect Workflow Approval Process
SELECT * FROM wf_item_attributes WHERE item_type = 'POAPPRV' AND item_key = 'YourPOKey';
query5: Review Position Hierarchy
SELECT * FROM hr_all_positions WHERE position_name = 'YourPositionName';
query6: Check Approval Transaction Data
SELECT * FROM po_headers_all WHERE segment1 = 'YourPONumber';
query7: Validate SQL Used in Attribute
Inspect the SQL used in the attribute 'CMG_GCPO' and 'CMG_ARCHPO' mentioned in the error, and ensure it returns 'Y' and 'N'.

the following error occurs.

ERROR
Oracle error -20001: ORA-20001: APP-FND-02901: You do not have access privilege to any operating unit. Please check if your profile option MO: Security Profile includes any operating unit or the profile option MO: Operating Unit is set. has been detected in MO_GLOBAL.INIT.

STEPS
The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:
1. Order Management responsibility
2. Open Order Organizer Form , Transaction Type Form
3. See the error

FACTS

Profiles MO: Security Profile , MO: Default Operating Unit , MO: Operating Unit have been set for the OM Responsibility in question.
APP-FND-02901.Cause:
Security List Maintenance program has not been run after setting up a new security profile.

This issue is described in Document 393634.1 R12: How To Setup Multi Org Access Control
(MOAC) for Order Management?

The Note says:
If you created a new security profile , you MUST run the concurrent program 'Security List
Maintenance' or the multiple operating units will not appear in the LOV in the OM forms.
APP-FND-02901.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Run the concurrent program 'Security List Maintenance'

Navigation: HRMS Management > HRMS Manager > Processes & Reports > Submit Process & Report > Security List Maintenance

2. Retest the issue.

3. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check Profile Option Settings
SELECT PROFILE_OPTION_NAME, PROFILE_OPTION_VALUE FROM FND_PROFILE_OPTIONS WHERE PROFILE_OPTION_NAME IN ('MO: Security Profile', 'MO: Default Operating Unit', 'MO: Operating Unit');
query2: Check Security Profile
SELECT SECURITY_PROFILE_NAME, ORG_ID FROM MO_SECURITY_PROFILES;
query3: Check Operating Unit Setup
SELECT ORGANIZATION_ID, ORGANIZATION_CODE, NAME FROM HR_ALL_ORGANIZATIONS WHERE ORGANIZATION_ID IN (SELECT ORG_ID FROM MO_SECURITY_PROFILES);
query4: Check Concurrent Program Execution

SELECT REQUEST_ID, CONCURRENT_PROGRAM_ID, PHASE_CODE, STATUS_CODE, TO_CHAR(CREATION_DATE, 'DD-MON-YYYY HH24:MI:SS') AS CREATION_DATE FROM FND_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS WHERE CONCURRENT_PROGRAM_ID IN (SELECT CONCURRENT_PROGRAM_ID FROM FND_CONCURRENT_PROGRAMS WHERE CONCURRENT_PROGRAM_NAME = 'Security List Maintenance') ORDER BY CREATION_DATE DESC;
query5: Check for the Latest Error Details
SELECT REQUEST_ID, LOG_FILE_NAME, OUTPUT_FILE_NAME FROM FND_CONCURRENT_REQUESTS WHERE REQUEST_ID = <REQUEST_ID_FROM_PREVIOUS_QUERY>;

APP-FND-01206.Applies To: Oracle Order Management - Version 12.2.10 and later
APP-FND-01206.Symptoms:

Getting below error while saving changes to Order Management documents

ERROR
-----------------------
APP-FND- 01206: This record already exists. You entered a duplicate value or sequence of values that must be unique for every record.

STEPS
-----------------------

2. Go to Order Management Super user responsibility

3. Setup->Orders->Attachments-> Documents

FROM oe_attachment_rule_elements;

SELECT * FROM dba_sequences
WHERE sequence_name = 'OE_ATTACHMENT_RULE_ELEMENTS_S';
APP-FND-01206.Solution:
Please log a Service Request with Oracle Order Management Product, providing

Screenshot of Error.
FND log captured for issue testcase as per Doc ID 1610072.1
Outputs of SQL01 and SQL02

query1: Check the maximum value of rule_element_id
SELECT MAX(rule_element_id) FROM oe_attachment_rule_elements;
query2: Verify the current value of the sequence OE_ATTACHMENT_RULE_ELEMENTS_S

Error ORA-04062.Symptoms:

ERROR
-----------------------

3. on the Sales Agreement form, query any existing Sales Agreement Number
4. Observe the error
Error ORA-04062.Cause:
The error ORA-04062: of has been changed is for some of the referenced api is complied and that made the library or form reference signature mismatch.

query1: Check the status of the referenced API
SELECT object_name, status FROM all_objects WHERE object_name = 'OE_BLANKET_FORM_CONTROL';

SELECT object_name, object_type FROM all_objects WHERE object_name = 'OE_BLANKET_FORM_CONTROL';

ORA-28110.Applies To:
Oracle Order Management - Version 12.1.3 and later
Oracle E-Business Suite Technology Stack - Version 12.0 and later
ORA-28110.Symptoms:
On : 12.1.3 version, Transaction Entry

An error is occurring when attempting to process an RMA Outbound using third party software call as seen below:

CALL APPS.wwbts_returns_outbound_pkg.wwont_returns_outbound(:errBuff, :retCode, :p_ont_return, :invNumber)} and ‘500’ value for invNumber parameter

ERROR
-----------------------
ORA-20001: An error was encountered - 1 -ERROR- - exception occured - ORA-20001: SQL_PLSQL_ERROR: N, ROUTINE, HR_SIGNON.INITIALIZE_HR_SECURITY, N, ERRNO, -28110, N, REASON, ORA-28110: policy function or package APPS.FND_PROFILE_OPTION_VALUES= has error


STEPS
-----------------------
The issue is occurring when invoking a third party package.
ORA-28110.Cause: If a policy function has compilation errors or does not exist, DBMS_RLS.ADD_POLICY will successfully complete but SELECT or DML will result in ORA-28110: policy function or package <schema.name> has error.
ORA-28110.Solution:
Please recompile the (packaged) function with the following statement:

CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION | PACKAGE or ALTER FUNCTION | PACKAGE COMPILE [BODY]

query1: Check if the policy function or package exists
SELECT OBJECT_NAME, OBJECT_TYPE FROM ALL_OBJECTS WHERE OBJECT_NAME = '<PLACEHOLDER>' AND OBJECT_TYPE IN ('FUNCTION', 'PACKAGE')
query2: Check for compilation errors in the policy function or package
SELECT TEXT FROM ALL_SOURCE WHERE NAME = '<PLACEHOLDER>' ORDER BY LINE
query3: Recompile the policy function or package
ALTER FUNCTION <PLACEHOLDER> COMPILE; -- OR CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION <PLACEHOLDER> COMPILE;
query4: Verify successful compilation
SELECT TEXT FROM ALL_SOURCE WHERE NAME = '<PLACEHOLDER>' ORDER BY LINE

ORA-01843.Applies To: Oracle Order Management - Version 12.2.9 and later
ORA-01843.Symptoms:
On : 12.2.9 version, ECC Order Management

When attempting to Full Import,
the following error occurs.

ERROR
-----------------------
ORA-01843: not a valid month


STEPS
-----------------------
The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:
1. Enterprise Command Center Developer
2. Data Load Submission
3. Full Load for Order Management
ORA-01843.Cause:
The cause of the issue is invalid date in Descriptive Flexfield segments
This issue is described in Bug 33774089 - OM COMMAND CENTER DATA LOAD ERROR ORA-01843: NOT A VALID MONTH
ORA-01843.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Do either one of these options:

#1
1. Go into the responsibility: Order Management responsibility
2. Append OE_HEADER_ATTRIBUTES, OE_LINE_ATTRIBUTES to the profile FND: ECC Disable Descriptive Flexfield value

#2
Fix date values in DFF segments.
The date should have the format of 'YYYY/MM/DD HH:MM:SS"

2. Retest the issue.

3. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Identify Records with Invalid Date Values
SELECT * FROM your_table WHERE TO_DATE(date_column, 'YYYY/MM/DD HH24:MI:SS', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = AMERICAN') IS NULL;
query2: List Distinct Invalid Date Values
SELECT DISTINCT date_column FROM your_table WHERE TO_DATE(date_column, 'YYYY/MM/DD HH24:MI:SS', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = AMERICAN') IS NULL;
query3: Check Descriptive Flexfield Segments for Invalid Dates
SELECT * FROM your_dff_table WHERE segment_name IN ('OE_HEADER_ATTRIBUTES', 'OE_LINE_ATTRIBUTES') AND TO_DATE(segment_value, 'YYYY/MM/DD HH24:MI:SS', 'NLS_DATE_LANGUAGE = AMERICAN') IS NULL;
query4: Find Records Related to Bug 33774089
SELECT * FROM your_table WHERE bug_id = '33774089';
query5: Verify Descriptive Flexfield Configuration
SELECT * FROM fnd_flex_validation_tables WHERE flex_value_set_name LIKE '%Order Management%';
query6: Check the Profile Option Values
SELECT profile_option_name, profile_option_value FROM fnd_profile_option_values WHERE profile_option_name = 'FND: ECC Disable Descriptive Flexfield value';

APP-ONT-251015.Applies To: Oracle Order Management - Version 12.1.1 and later
APP-ONT-251015.Symptoms:
After booking and partially reserving an Order line, status becomes 'SUPPLY PARTIAL'.
This can be only progressed by running AutoCreate Final Assembly Orders to create WIP job for remaining item.
This cannot be progressed by doing Actions > Progress Order.
APP-ONT-251015.Solution:
This is the expected behavior. Since the Order line is reserved partially, the line has moved to Ship_line notified status.
Now any of the following step should be used to progress the line.

1. Run AutoCreate Final Assembly Orders to create WIP job for remaining item.

or

2. Ship the quantity that being reserved. After Interface Trip Stop is run, the line will
split and the new line that is not yet shipped will be at Supply Eligible
status which can be progressed from Sales Order Form.

query1: Check Order Line Status and Reservation Information

SELECT ooh.order_number, ool.line_id, ool.line_number, ool.inventory_item_id, ool.order_quantity, ool.shipped_quantity, ool.reservation_quantity, ool.line_status FROM oe_order_headers_all ooh JOIN oe_order_lines_all ool ON ooh.header_id = ool.header_id WHERE ooh.order_number = '<Order_Number>';
query2: Check for Partially Reserved Lines
SELECT ool.line_id, ool.line_number, ool.inventory_item_id, ool.order_quantity, ool.reservation_quantity, ool.line_status FROM oe_order_lines_all ool WHERE ool.line_status = 'SUPPLY PARTIAL';
query3: Check AutoCreate Final Assembly Orders (AFCO) Information

SELECT ool.line_id, ool.line_number, ool.inventory_item_id, ool.order_quantity, ool.reservation_quantity, ool.line_status, aia.wip_entity_id FROM oe_order_lines_all ool JOIN wip_entities aia ON ool.line_id = aia.sales_order_line_id WHERE ool.line_status = 'SUPPLY PARTIAL';
query4: Check Interface Trip Stop Information

SELECT ool.line_id, ool.line_number, ool.inventory_item_id, ool.order_quantity, ool.reservation_quantity, ool.line_status, ool.ship_from_org_id FROM oe_order_lines_all ool JOIN wsh_delivery_details wdd ON ool.line_id = wdd.source_line_id WHERE ool.line_status = 'SUPPLY PARTIAL';

APP-ONT-251736.Applies To: Oracle Order Management - Version 12.0 to 12.1.3 [Release 12.0 to 12.1]
APP-ONT-251736.Symptoms:
Receive error opening the sales order form:
APP-ONT-251736: Defaulting will occur after the Operating Unit is specified

Steps to reproduce the issue:
1. Navigate to Order Management Super User -> Order,Returns
2.  Open Sales Order form
3. Noticed the error
APP-ONT-251736: Defaulting will occur after the Operating Unit is specified
APP-ONT-251736.Cause:
Operating Unit is not defaulted to the sales order form.

If the OU is not defaulted, that message will show up. It is the expected behavior.
APP-ONT-251736.Solution:
Verify set up of profiles for MO: Security Profile and MO: Default operating unit. Make sure your defaulting operating unit is present in your security profile.

Please refer to MOAC Note 393634.1 and Order Management Implementation guide for setup details.

query1: Check MO: Security Profile
SELECT PROFILE_NAME, ORG_ID FROM MO_SECURITY_PROFILES WHERE PROFILE_NAME = 'Your_Security_Profile';
query2: Check MO: Default Operating Unit
SELECT PROFILE_OPTION_NAME, PROFILE_OPTION_VALUE FROM FND_PROFILE_OPTIONS WHERE PROFILE_OPTION_NAME = 'MO: Operating Unit';
query3: Verify Security Profile Assignment
SELECT * FROM MO_SECURITY_PROFILE_ASSIGNMENTS WHERE SECURITY_PROFILE_NAME = 'Your_Security_Profile';
query4: Check Operating Unit Defaulting
SELECT ORGANIZATION_ID, ORGANIZATION_CODE FROM HR_OPERATING_UNITS WHERE ORGANIZATION_CODE = 'Your_Operating_Unit_Code';
query5: Verify MOAC Setup
SELECT PROFILE_OPTION_NAME, PROFILE_OPTION_VALUE FROM FND_PROFILE_OPTIONS WHERE PROFILE_OPTION_NAME IN ('MO: Security Profile', 'MO: Operating Unit');
query6: Check Responsibility Setup
SELECT RESPONSIBILITY_NAME, APPLICATION_ID, ORG_ID FROM FND_RESPONSIBILITY_V WHERE RESPONSIBILITY_NAME = 'Your_Order_Management_Responsibility';

APP-ONT-251090.Symptoms:
Getting following error in Order Import Corrections Form and does not know how to clear it.  When clicking on ERRORS button the query does not return any records.  How does one clear this error?

Note
APP-ONT-251090: Order failed with errors.

Note
Error You are trying to insert an existing order or update an order that does not exist. Please enter a correct operation code.
APP-ONT-251090.Solution:
For Orig_Sys_Document_Ref, not existing in Order management base tables (with any Sales Order - XML as source), the operation code in Corrections screen (Iface tables) should be CREATE, whereas for the one existing with any created Sales Order, it should be UPDATE.

Change the operation code in Corrections form to either Create or Update.

query1: Check for Existing Orders with the Same Orig_Sys_Document_Ref:
SELECT * FROM oe_order_headers_all WHERE orig_sys_document_ref = ?
query2: Check Interface Tables for Orders with the Error:
SELECT * FROM oe_headers_iface_all WHERE orig_sys_document_ref = ?
query3: Check for Duplicate Orders in Interface Tables:
SELECT orig_sys_document_ref, COUNT(*) FROM oe_headers_iface_all GROUP BY orig_sys_document_ref HAVING COUNT(*) > 1
query4: Check for Existing Orders with the Error in Corrections Form:
SELECT * FROM oe_order_headers_all WHERE order_number IN (SELECT order_number FROM oe_headers_iface_all WHERE orig_sys_document_ref = ?)
query5: Check Corrections Form Operation Codes:
SELECT orig_sys_document_ref, operation_code FROM oe_headers_iface_all WHERE orig_sys_document_ref = ?

APP-ONT-251013.Applies To: Oracle Order Management - Version 12.2.6 and later
APP-ONT-251013.Symptoms:
On : 12.2.6 version, Transaction Booking

When attempting to progress sales order...
APP-ONT-251013.Cause: Observed a large number of sales order where the lines are stuck in 'Scheduled' status...
APP-ONT-251013.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Ensure that you have taken a backup of your system before applying the recommended solution.

2. Run the following scripts in a TEST environment first:
  Script 1 -- > (Set_ShipLine_Notified.sql') to change the line status from 'Scheduled' to 'Awaiting Shipping'.
  Script 2 --> (Close_inv_lines.sql) to change the line status from "Interfaced to Receivables".

3. Once the scripts complete, confirm that the data is corrected.
You can use the following SQL to confirm:

4. If you are satisfied with the results, issue a commit.

5. Confirm that the data is corrected when viewed in the Oracle Applications.

You can use the following steps:
a. Run the script<close_inv_lines.sql> by providing the line_id:xxxxxx as an input while prompting at run time.
b. Verify the status of the line. If it is not closed, Provide the latest HTMomse file along with debug file generated.
c. Run the script<Set_ShipLine_Notified.sql'> by providing the line_id:xxxxxx as an input while prompting at run time and then ship the item, progress the line til closure.

6. If you are satisfied that the issue is resolved, migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Identify Orders with Stuck Lines

SELECT DISTINCT h.order_number, h.header_id, l.line_id, l.FLOW_STATUS_CODE
FROM OE_ORDER_LINES_ALL l, OE_ORDER_HEADERS_ALL h
WHERE l.open_flag = 'Y'
AND h.open_flag = 'Y'
AND l.booked_flag = 'Y'
AND l.shipping_interfaced_flag = 'N'
AND l.shippable_flag = 'Y'
AND NVL(l.fulfilled_flag, 'N') = 'N'
AND h.header_id = l.header_id
AND EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM WF_ITEM_ACTIVITY_STATUSES ST, WF_PROCESS_ACTIVITIES PA
    WHERE ST.ITEM_TYPE = 'OEOL'
    AND ST.ITEM_KEY = TO_CHAR(l.line_id)
    AND st.end_date IS NULL
    AND ST.PROCESS_ACTIVITY = PA.INSTANCE_ID
    AND ST.activity_status = 'ERROR'
    AND PA.process_name = 'UPG_SHIPPING_SUB'
    AND pa.activity_name = 'SHIP_LINE'
)
AND NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM WSH_DELIVERY_DETAILS wdd
    WHERE wdd.source_line_id = l.line_id
    AND wdd.released_status = 'R'
    AND wdd.source_code = 'OE'
);
query2: Check Invalid/Incorrect Data

SELECT DISTINCT h.order_number, h.header_id, l.line_id, l.FLOW_STATUS_CODE
FROM OE_ORDER_LINES_ALL l, OE_ORDER_HEADERS_ALL h
WHERE l.open_flag = 'Y'
AND h.open_flag = 'Y'
AND l.booked_flag = 'Y'
AND l.shipping_interfaced_flag = 'N'
AND l.shippable_flag = 'Y'
AND NVL(l.fulfilled_flag, 'N') = 'N'
AND h.header_id = l.header_id
AND EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM WF_ITEM_ACTIVITY_STATUSES ST, WF_PROCESS_ACTIVITIES PA
    WHERE ST.ITEM_TYPE = 'OEOL'
    AND ST.ITEM_KEY = TO_CHAR(l.line_id)
    AND st.end_date IS NULL
    AND ST.PROCESS_ACTIVITY = PA.INSTANCE_ID
    AND ST.activity_status = 'ERROR'
    AND PA.process_name = 'UPG_SHIPPING_SUB'
    AND pa.activity_name = 'SHIP_LINE'
)
AND NOT EXISTS (
    SELECT 1
    FROM WSH_DELIVERY_DETAILS wdd
    WHERE wdd.source_line_id = l.line_id
    AND wdd.released_status = 'R'
    AND wdd.source_code = 'OE'
);

FRM-40212.Applies To:
Oracle Inventory Management - Version 12.1.3 and later
Oracle Landed Cost Management - Version 12.1.3 and later
FRM-40212.Symptoms:
ACTUAL BEHAVIOR

--------------------

While doing a Receipt for a LCM Shipment, in a Pre-Receiving organization, the following error occurs:
FRM-40212.Cause: This happens due to "duplicate" shipment records stuck in rcv_transactions_interface for the related Shipment. Perhaps, user created multiple LCM shipments for the same PO as the shipment was stuck in Receiving. LCM shipment showed completed, but, was never available on Receiving side to complete the receipt.
FRM-40212.Solution:
There should only be one shipment being processed for the PO . If the same PO is included in multiple LCM shipments, you may encounter the same error.

If you are facing the same issue, Please log an SR with the INV debug log and Receiving analyzer for the PO from Note (OR) INL: Data Collection By Shipment Number output, as per note Oracle Landed Cost Management Data Collection By Shipment Number Transaction Data Test (Note 732478.1), for the concerned LCM Shipment.

query1: Identify Duplicate Shipment Records
SELECT * FROM rcv_transactions_interface WHERE shipment_number = '<YourShipmentNumber>' AND po_number = '<YourPONumber>' AND transaction_type IN ('RECEIVE', 'RETURN');
query2: Check for Multiple LCM Shipments for the Same PO
SELECT shipment_number, COUNT(*) FROM rcv_transactions_interface WHERE po_number = '<YourPONumber>' AND transaction_type IN ('RECEIVE', 'RETURN') GROUP BY shipment_number HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
query3: Get Details of LCM Shipment Errors
SELECT * FROM your_lcm_error_table WHERE shipment_number = '<YourShipmentNumber>';
query4: Check LCM Shipments Status
SELECT * FROM your_lcm_shipment_table WHERE shipment_number = '<YourShipmentNumber>';
query5: Review INV Debug Log for the Specific PO
SELECT * FROM inv_debug_log WHERE po_number = '<YourPONumber>';
query6: Analyze Receiving Transactions for the PO
SELECT * FROM receiving_analyzer WHERE po_number = '<YourPONumber>';
query7: Data Collection By Shipment Number for the Concerned LCM Shipment
SELECT * FROM your_lcm_data_collection_table WHERE shipment_number = '<YourShipmentNumber>';

APP-FND-00906.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 11.5.10.2 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
This document includes all versions of Oracle EBS 11i and R12
APP-FND-00906.Symptoms:
User(s) are unable to query items in Bill of Materials form. Ctrl+F11 queries some items with unknown logic. Other items cannot be queried using this form, however they can be queried using the master items form.

The error message is as following:

Form Error Message
APP-FND-00906: You can only query existing flexfield code combinations. You entered query
criteria in your flexfield that does not identify an existing code combination. Therefore, your
query will not return any rows.
Enter a valid code combination, or enter only the flexfield segment values you know, or do not
enter any values in the flexfield.
APP-FND-00906.Cause:
A. Parameter
The parameter std_item_access value is not set for the problematic user(s) which is why they are not able to access the Bill of Materials

This is explained in the following bug:
Bug 7669375: BOMFDBOM- ONE USER GETS ERROR APP-FND-00906

B. BOM Allowed
The item was not setup as BOM Allowed. The BOM Allowed flag is setup on the item screen.

C. Engineering Bill
Assembly_type is 2 (Engineering)  in bom_bill_of_materials / bom_structures_b
APP-FND-00906.Solution:
A. For the parameter:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Go into the responsibility: System Administrator

2. Navigate to Profiles

3. Set Profile "BOM: Standard Item Access" to YES for the user(s).

4. Retest the issue.

5. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

B. For BOM Allowed:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Go into the responsibility: Inventory

2. Navigate to Items > Item Master

3. Query the item and ensure the "BOM Allowed" Flag is checked to Yes.

4. Retest the issue.

5. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

C. For Engineering Bill:
1. Go into the responsibility : Engineering  .

2. Navigate to Prototypes > Bills > Bills

3. Query for the Bill

4. Go to Tools > Transfer Bill > Check box :  Implemented Only (checked) , Selection option: All,

5. Retest the issue.

6. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check Parameter Setting

SELECT * FROM fnd_profile_options WHERE profile_option_name = 'BOM: Standard Item Access';
SELECT * FROM fnd_profile_option_values WHERE profile_option_id = (SELECT profile_option_id FROM fnd_profile_options WHERE profile_option_name = 'BOM: Standard Item Access') AND level_value = (SELECT user_id FROM fnd_user WHERE user_name = 'USERNAME');
query2: Check BOM Allowed Setting
SELECT * FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE segment1 = 'YOUR_ITEM_CODE';
query3: Check Engineering Bill Setting
SELECT * FROM eng.bom_bill_of_materials WHERE assembly_item_id = (SELECT inventory_item_id FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE segment1 = 'YOUR_ITEM_CODE');

APP-BOM-28282.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 11.5.10.2 and later
Oracle Enterprise Asset Management - Version 11.5.10 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
APP-BOM-28282.Symptoms:
When attempting to access the Asset BOM form in Enterprise Asset Management Responsibility or Bills form in Bills of Materials responsibility, the following error occurs:

APP-BOM-28282: You do not have access to any of the item types. Bills of Material definition form
can be accessed only if you have at least one of the Model, Standard, Planning or Option Class item
types.

Action: Please contact your system Administrator to allow access to at least one of the item types

The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:
1. Enterprise Asset Management > Assets > Asset BOM
or
2 Bills of Materials > Bills > Bills
APP-BOM-28282.Cause:
All three of the following profiles were set to NO:

BOM: Model Item Access
BOM: Planning Item Access
BOM: Standard Item Access


BOM: Model Item Access

Indicates whether a holder of this responsibility can define and update bills of material for
model and option class items.

BOM: Planning Item Access

Indicates whether a holder of this responsibility can define and update bills of material for
planning items.

BOM: Standard Item Access

Indicates whether a holder of this responsibility can define and update bills of material for
standard items.
APP-BOM-28282.Solution:
1. Go into the responsibility: System Administrator

2. Navigate to Profiles > System

3. Set at least one of the following profiles to YES either at site, application, or user level

BOM: Model Item Access
BOM: Planning Item Access
BOM: Standard Item Access

4. Retest the issue.

5. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check the current values of the profiles mentioned in the 'Cause' section

SELECT PROFILE_NAME, PROFILE_OPTION_NAME, PROFILE_OPTION_VALUE FROM FND_PROFILE_OPTION_VALUES WHERE PROFILE_NAME IN ('BOM: Model Item Access', 'BOM: Planning Item Access', 'BOM: Standard Item Access');
query2: Verify the responsibility assignments for the affected user

SELECT DISTINCT fa.application_id, fa.responsibility_id, fr.responsibility_key, fr.responsibility_name, fu.user_id, fu.user_name FROM fnd_user fu JOIN fnd_responsibility_tl fr ON fu.user_id = fr.user_id JOIN fnd_user_resp_groups_direct fur ON fu.user_id = fur.user_id JOIN fnd_application fa ON fur.application_id = fa.application_id WHERE fr.responsibility_key IN ('SYSTEM_ADMINISTRATOR', 'ENTERPRISE_ASSET_MGMT_RESP', 'BILLS_OF_MATERIAL_RESP');
query3: Check if the user has the required responsibilities and access

SELECT fu.user_name, fr.responsibility_key, fr.responsibility_name FROM fnd_user_resp_groups_direct fur JOIN fnd_responsibility_tl fr ON fur.responsibility_id = fr.responsibility_id JOIN fnd_user fu ON fur.user_id = fu.user_id WHERE fr.responsibility_key IN ('ENTERPRISE_ASSET_MGMT_RESP', 'BILLS_OF_MATERIAL_RESP');
query4: Verify the access granted through profile options

SELECT fur.user_id, fr.responsibility_key, fpo.profile_name, fpo.profile_option_name, fpo.profile_option_value FROM fnd_user_resp_groups_direct fur JOIN fnd_responsibility_tl fr ON fur.responsibility_id = fr.responsibility_id JOIN fnd_profile_option_values fpo ON fur.user_id = fpo.level_value WHERE fr.responsibility_key IN ('ENTERPRISE_ASSET_MGMT_RESP', 'BILLS_OF_MATERIAL_RESP') AND fpo.profile_name IN ('BOM: Model Item Access', 'BOM: Planning Item Access', 'BOM: Standard Item Access');

APP-FND-01050.Applies To:
"Oracle Bills of Material - Version 12.2.7 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform."
APP-FND-01050.Symptoms:
1. Non-locator control organization.

 2. Define the routing details, add the subinventory, cursor move to locator, error out:

APP-FND-01050: The flexfield cannot be opened because it has no displayed segments.
APP-FND-01050.Cause: The cause of the issue is Key Flexfield (KFF) of stock locator is not setup.
APP-FND-01050.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Go into the responsibility: Inventory.

2. Navigate to Setup>Flexfields>Key>Segments, query for Application=Inventory, Flexfield Title=Stock Locators, open. 3. Un-check "Freeze Flexfield Definition" box.

4. Click Segments button, define one segment for locator, make sure "Displayed" box is checked, and save.                               5. Check Freeze flexfield definition checkbox, compile.

6. Retest the issue.

7. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check Existing Flexfield Segments

SELECT ff.application_id, ff.id_flex_code, ff.id_flex_num, ffs.segment_name, ffs.segment_column_name, ffs.application_table_name FROM flex_flexfields ff, flex_segments ffs WHERE ff.id_flex_code = 'INV' AND ff.id_flex_num = <Your_Stock_Locators_Flexfield_ID>;
query2: Check Flexfield Structure
SELECT * FROM flex_value_sets WHERE flex_value_set_id = <Your_Stock_Locators_Flexfield_ID>;
query3: Verify Freeze Flexfield Definition
SELECT freeze_flexfield_definition FROM flex_flexfields WHERE id_flex_code = 'INV' AND id_flex_num = <Your_Stock_Locators_Flexfield_ID>;
query4: Check Segment Displayed Setting
SELECT segment_name, enabled_flag FROM flex_segments WHERE id_flex_code = 'INV' AND id_flex_num = <Your_Stock_Locators_Flexfield_ID>;

APP-FND-01238.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 12.2.10 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
Applies to BOMFDBOM / BOMFDRTG forms.
APP-FND-01238.Symptoms:
Error when querying bills or routings on View only version of the form.  There are no personalizations or customizations on the form. This is a seeded version of the Routings form and the user's responsibility has functions "Bills of Material: Update" ,  "Routings: Update" excluded.

Error
-----
APP-FND-01238 : Cannot Set Value For Field B_OP_RTGS.ITEM_DESCRIPTION

Steps to replicate the issue:
1. System Administrator > Security > Responsibility > Define > Create a test responsibility - Bills of Material (View Only Bill/Routing)
2. Provide menu : BOM_NAVIGATE_GUI
3. Exclude functions below :
Bills of Material: Update
Routings: Update
4. Assign the responsibility to any user
5. Log back in using the new responsibility and Open Bills form > Query for any existing Bill > See error
6. Open Routings form >  Query for any existing routing > See error
APP-FND-01238.Cause: Profile 'Flexfields:Validate On Server' was set to Yes.  If this profile value is set as 'Yes' then it tries to validate the form field references (:block.field) raising the exception when its in the read-only mode.
APP-FND-01238.Solution:
SUMMARY:  With this profile set to 'Yes' the validation request will be sent to the server and no network traffic happens until the validation is complete,
whereas without server validation, each SQL lookup is driven from client code. The actual validation that takes place will be the same, whether done with Validate on Server set to  'Yes' or 'No'.

Additionally, If you are using flexfields server-side validation, you cannot use form field references (:block.field) on a Read only version.  
You must either remove your field references or turn off flexfields server-side validation.

One misconception is that this profile will turn off validation. It does NOT turn validation off.
Its purpose is to help performance for users with wide-area network environments by reducing the network traffic associated with flex validation.  

To implement the solution, please follow below steps -

1. System administrator > Profiles > System profiles > Query for "Flexfields: Validate on Server" > Set value to 'No'

2. Save and retest the issue.

query1: Check 'Flexfields: Validate On Server' Profile Value
SELECT PROFILE_OPTION_ID, PROFILE_OPTION_NAME, LEVEL_ID, LEVEL_VALUE FROM FND_PROFILE_OPTION_VALUES WHERE PROFILE_OPTION_NAME = 'FLEXFIELDS:VALIDATE_ON_SERVER';
query2: Check Responsibility Details
SELECT RESPONSIBILITY_ID, RESPONSIBILITY_NAME, APPLICATION_ID, MENU_ID FROM FND_RESPONSIBILITY_VL WHERE RESPONSIBILITY_NAME = 'YourResponsibilityName';
query3: Check if Functions are Excluded for the Responsibility

SELECT FUNCTION_ID, FUNCTION_NAME, EXCLUDED_FLAG FROM FND_RESP_FUNCTIONS WHERE RESPONSIBILITY_ID = (SELECT RESPONSIBILITY_ID FROM FND_RESPONSIBILITY_VL WHERE RESPONSIBILITY_NAME = 'YourResponsibilityName');
query4: Check Profile Values for the Affected User
SELECT USER_ID, USER_NAME FROM FND_USER WHERE USER_NAME = 'YourUserName';
query5: Check 'FLEXFIELDS:ENABLE_SERVER_SIDE_VALIDATION' Profile Value
SELECT PROFILE_OPTION_ID, PROFILE_OPTION_NAME, LEVEL_ID, LEVEL_VALUE FROM FND_PROFILE_OPTION_VALUES WHERE PROFILE_OPTION_NAME = 'FLEXFIELDS:ENABLE_SERVER_SIDE_VALIDATION';
query6: Check for Field References in Flexfields
SELECT BLOCK_NAME, FIELD_NAME FROM FND_FLEX_SERVER_VALIDATORS WHERE FIELD_REFERENCE = ':block.field';
query7: Check Last Update of the Solution Document
SELECT DOCUMENT_ID, DOCUMENT_NAME, LAST_UPDATE_DATE FROM FND_DOCUMENTS WHERE DOCUMENT_NAME = 'APP-FND-01238';

APP-BOM-20156.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 12.2.3 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
APP-BOM-20156.Symptoms:
On : 12.2.3 version, Routings

  When user is attempting to delete a resource from department, the following error is thrown

  ERROR
  -----------------------
  APP-BOM-20156: You cannot delete this resource. An operation references <Resource Name>.
  Cause: You cannot delete resource <Resource Name>. A routing operation references <Resource Name>.
  Action: Disable resource <Resource Name>.

  EXPECTATION
  -----------------
  Should be able to delete resource from the department

STEPS
-----------------------
The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:

1) From Bills of Material Responsibility, Open Departments form
    Bills of Materials > Routings > Departments
3) Query for the department to which the resource is assigned and needs to deleted
4) Click Resources button
5) Select the resource to be deleted from the department
6) Edit > Delete from menu. The error message is thrown
APP-BOM-20156.Cause:
To be able to delete a resource from a department, the following constraints should be met
Constraint	Identification SQL
No shifts defined for the resource in the department	SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS
            (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_RESOURCE_SHIFTS
             WHERE DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id
               AND RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id);
The resource should NOT be shared with other departments	SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS
            (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_DEPARTMENT_RESOURCES
             WHERE SHARE_FROM_DEPT_ID = &Department_Id
              AND RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id);
No standard operations using the resource	SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS
            (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_STD_OP_RESOURCES bsor,
              BOM_STANDARD_OPERATIONS bso
             WHERE bso.STANDARD_OPERATION_ID = bsor.STANDARD_OPERATION_ID
               AND bso.DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id
               AND bsor.RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id);
No routing operations using the resource

(Even though the operations are disabled)

SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS
            (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_OPERATION_RESOURCES bor,
             BOM_OPERATION_SEQUENCES bos
             WHERE bor.OPERATION_SEQUENCE_ID = bos.OPERATION_SEQUENCE_ID
               AND bor.RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id
               AND bos.DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id);
No unclosed WIP jobs using the resource
SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS
            (SELECT 1 FROM WIP_OPERATIONS wo,
                           WIP_OPERATION_RESOURCES wor,
                           WIP_DISCRETE_JOBS wdj
             WHERE wo.WIP_ENTITY_ID = wor.WIP_ENTITY_ID
               AND wdj.WIP_ENTITY_ID = wo.WIP_ENTITY_ID
               AND wo.OPERATION_SEQ_NUM = wor.OPERATION_SEQ_NUM
               AND wo.ORGANIZATION_ID = wor.ORGANIZATION_ID
               AND nvl(wo.REPETITIVE_SCHEDULE_ID, -1) = nvl(wor.REPETITIVE_SCHEDULE_ID, -1)
               AND wor.RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id
               AND wo.DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id
               AND wdj.STATUS_TYPE <> 12);
APP-BOM-20156.Solution:
Identify the constraint that is not allowing to delete resource from department.
If there are WIP jobs using the resource, close the jobs.
If there is other data, check with business, clear the data and try to delete resource from department

query1: Check if shifts are defined for the resource in the department
SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_RESOURCE_SHIFTS WHERE DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id AND RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id);
query2: Check if the resource is shared with other departments
SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_DEPARTMENT_RESOURCES WHERE SHARE_FROM_DEPT_ID = &Department_Id AND RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id);
query3: Check if there are standard operations using the resource

SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_STD_OP_RESOURCES bsor JOIN BOM_STANDARD_OPERATIONS bso ON bso.STANDARD_OPERATION_ID = bsor.STANDARD_OPERATION_ID WHERE bso.DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id AND bsor.RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id);
query4: Check if there are routing operations using the resource

SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM BOM_OPERATION_RESOURCES bor JOIN BOM_OPERATION_SEQUENCES bos ON bor.OPERATION_SEQUENCE_ID = bos.OPERATION_SEQUENCE_ID WHERE bor.RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id AND bos.DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id);
query5: Check if there are unclosed WIP jobs using the resource

SELECT 1 FROM DUAL WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM WIP_OPERATIONS wo JOIN WIP_OPERATION_RESOURCES wor ON wo.WIP_ENTITY_ID = wor.WIP_ENTITY_ID JOIN WIP_DISCRETE_JOBS wdj ON wo.WIP_ENTITY_ID = wdj.WIP_ENTITY_ID WHERE wor.RESOURCE_ID = &Resource_Id AND wo.DEPARTMENT_ID = &Department_Id AND wdj.STATUS_TYPE <> 12);

Bug 29474666 - COMPUTE LEAD TIMES PROGRAM COMPLETES IN ERROR FOR SOME PART#S

APP-BOM-20597.Solution:

query1: Check Program Log

APP-BOM-20273.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 12.0.6 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
APP-BOM-20273.Cause:
Duplicate Above Record on BOM Components causes irrecoverable error APP-BOM-20273 due to non-unique Op Sequence; cannot edit record, unless cleared.

The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:
1. Bills -> Bills
2. Query the bill of material in the form.
3. Use green plus sign to add a new record.
4. Edit -> Duplicate -> Record Above to copy the above record.
5. Scroll to the Quantity field and adjust the quantity to a portion of existing quantity.
6. Save and get message about effectivity date.
7. Select Effectivity Date tab to adjust the effectivity date.
8. As soon as new date is selected, see the below message.


APP-BOM-20273: Component Item exists for this operation sequence and date range.

9. Click on OK.
10. Attempt to select the Main tab to change the Operation Sequence and error reappears. Cannot successfully navigate to field to change the value.
APP-BOM-20273.Solution:
This is expected behavior. Form Trigger would not allow continuing as the validation happens on effective date, and it needs the operation sequence to be different, if the component is identical.

1) When you encounter this, Please use F6 or (Clear) record, and enter it again. After duplicating the record, Please change the operation sequence on the line first, and then proceed to update the effective date, this will not cause any errors.

2) The other way to get around this is to clear the effective date alone, go back to operation sequence, modify it, then change effective date and save the record.

query1: Identify Duplicate Records
SELECT * FROM your_bom_table WHERE operation_sequence IN ( SELECT operation_sequence FROM your_bom_table GROUP BY operation_sequence HAVING COUNT(*) > 1 );
query2: Check for Non-Unique Operation Sequences
SELECT operation_sequence, COUNT(*) FROM your_bom_table GROUP BY operation_sequence HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
query3: Inspect Components with Identical Operation Sequences
SELECT * FROM your_bom_table WHERE operation_sequence = 'your_duplicate_sequence';
query4: Identify Components with Same Operation Sequence and Date Range
SELECT * FROM your_bom_table WHERE operation_sequence = 'your_sequence' AND effectivity_date = 'your_date';
query5: Check for Components with Same Item, Operation Sequence, and Date Range
SELECT * FROM your_bom_table WHERE component_item = 'your_item' AND operation_sequence = 'your_sequence' AND effectivity_date = 'your_date';
query6: Inspect Records with APP-BOM-20273 Error
SELECT * FROM your_bom_table WHERE error_code = 'APP-BOM-20273';
query7: Review the Latest Updates
SELECT * FROM your_bom_table WHERE last_update >= TO_DATE('2021-11-24', 'YYYY-MM-DD');

APP-BOM-20252.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 11.5.7 to 12.2.4 [Release 11.5 to 12.2]
Information in this document applies to any platform.

Receive the following error while modifying a common bill which has an associated organization disabled...

* The system does not allow it as the new item cannot be enabled in CH5 as the Organization: CH5 is disabled - Error message: APP-BOM-20252
APP-BOM-20252.Cause:
A.Child Organization Disabled...
B. Item NOT Present...
APP-BOM-20252.Solution:
A.Child Organization Disabled...
Or using a Data fix:...

query1: Identify Disabled Organizations
SELECT ood.organization_id, ood.organization_code, ood.disable_date FROM org_organization_definitions ood WHERE ood.disable_date IS NOT NULL;
query2: Check Common Bills and Organizations

APP-FND-01934.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 12.1.3 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
APP-FND-01934.Symptoms:
Rollup Cumulative Lead Times GUI Completing in Error/Running unusually long (running for 12+ hours)

ERROR

APP-FND-01934: ORA-01555: snapshot too old: rollback segment number with name "" too small in Package BOMPCCLT Procedure explode_assy(3)
STEPS

The issue can be reproduced intermittently with the following steps:
1. Run Rollup Cumulative Lead Times, see error after a long wait.
APP-FND-01934.Cause:
This delay in performance is caused by a coding problem.

The best execution plan for the subquery when there are many rows in
 BOM_LOW_LEVEL_CODES will always be an index unique/range scan of
 BOM_LOW_LEVEL_CODES_U1. If there are very few rows then this will not be an
 additional overhead.

 Developers added a SQL Hint to advise the Cost-based Optimizer to do this.

Select /*+ INDEX(bllc BOM_LOW_LEVEL_CODES_U1 */ null
--added hint for Bug 19001843
  From bom_low_level_codes bllc
...

This is described in Bug 19001843 - ROLLUP CUMULATIVE LEAD TIMES GUI COMPLETING IN ERROR/RUNNING UNUSUALLY LONG
APP-FND-01934.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Download and review the readme and pre-requisites for the appropriate patch for your environment: 

Patch/File Details
Release	Patch	File/Version
12.1.x	Patch 19001843:R12.BOM.C	BOMCCLTB.pls 120.2.12010000.2
12.2.x	Patch 19001843:R12.BOM.D	BOMCCLTB.pls 120.2.12020000.2
2. Ensure that you have taken a backup of your system before applying the recommended patch.
3. Apply the patch in a test environment.
4. Confirm the upgrade file version. You can use Unix commands like 

strings -a $BOM_TOP/patch/115/sql/BOMCCLTB.pls | grep '$Header'
Or you could run the Apps Check for Application Parameter: Bills of Material -- refer to Note 276207.1.

5. Retest the issue.
6. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check active sessions
SELECT * FROM v$session WHERE status = 'ACTIVE';
query2: Identify blocking sessions
SELECT blocking_session, sid, serial#, wait_class, seconds_in_wait FROM v$session WHERE blocking_session IS NOT NULL;
query3: Check rollback segments
SELECT tablespace_name, segment_name, status FROM dba_rollback_segs;
query4: View SQL statements currently executing
SELECT s.sql_id, s.sql_text, s.elapsed_time, s.executions, s.fetches, s.parse_calls FROM v$sql s JOIN v$session ss ON s.sql_id = ss.sql_id WHERE ss.status = 'ACTIVE';
query5: Check for long-running SQL statements
SELECT sql_id, sql_text, elapsed_time, executions, fetches, parse_calls FROM v$sql WHERE elapsed_time > (60 * 5) ORDER BY elapsed_time DESC;
query6: Query for affected package and procedure
SELECT owner, object_name, object_type FROM all_objects WHERE object_name IN ('BOMPCCLT', 'explode_assy') AND object_type IN ('PACKAGE', 'PROCEDURE');
query7: Check for index usage in the problematic query
EXPLAIN PLAN FOR SELECT /*+ INDEX(bllc BOM_LOW_LEVEL_CODES_U1) */ null FROM bom_low_level_codes bllc;
query8: ANALYZE TABLE bom_low_level_codes COMPUTE STATISTICS; ANALYZE INDEX BOM_LOW_LEVEL_CODES_U1 COMPUTE STATISTICS;

APP-FND-01048.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 11.5.9 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
This document includes all versions of Oracle EBS 11i and R12
APP-FND-01048.Symptoms:
Errors similar to the following are displayed when trying to define a new Bill of Material (BOM) for a particular item using the Bill Define form (BOMFDBOM.fmb). This occurs after entering or selecting an item.

Error 1:
            No entries found for List of Values
            --------------------------------------------------------------
            APP-FND-01436: List of Values cannot find any values for you to choose

            Cause: The List of Values execution failed to find any values.

            Cause: The SQL statement specified to fdlfch() failed to return any values.

            Action: Check the message stack for any SQL statement failure messages.
            Check to make sure your SQL statement works in SQL*Plus.
            (ROUTINE=fdlfch)
            --------------------------------------------------------------

Error 2:
            No entries found for List of Values

            --------------------------------------------------------------
            APP-FND-01048: Use of this combination restricted by WHERE clause
            ' ( ((:parameter.query_mode = 2 AND bom_enabled_flag = 'Y')
            OR (:parameter.query_mode = 1 AND EXISTS (SELECT NULL FROM
            bom_bill_of_materials bom WHERE bom.organization_id =
            :parameter.org_id AND bom.assembly_item_id = inventory_item_id
            AND ((:parameter.bom_or_eng = 1 AND assembly_type = 1) OR
            :parameter.bom_or_eng = 2) ))) AND (bom_item_type in
            (:parameter.model_item_access, :parameter.planning_item_access,
            :parameter.std_item_access, :parameter.oc_item_access) ) AND
            ((:parameter.bom_or_eng = 1 AND eng_item_flag = 'N' AND NOT
            EXISTS (SELECT 'X' FROM bom_bill_of_materials bom WHERE
            bom.organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND bom.assembly_item_id
            = inventory_item_id AND bom.alternate_bom_designator IS NULL AND
            bom.assembly_type <> 1) AND (:parameter.eam_type is null OR
            (:parameter.eam_type in (1, 2)
APP-FND-01048.Cause:
The errors indicate that the item you have entered or selected is not available for use as restricted by the displayed where clause. In order to use a particular item to define a new bill, certain criteria must be met. These are:

The item must exist in the current organization
The item must be BOM Enabled
The item's BOM Item Type attribute must be one of the following:

Model (1)*
Option Class(2)*
Planning (3)
Standard (4)

* In Process Manufacturing (OPM) enabled organizations, items with BOM Item Types of Model and Option Class are also excluded from the LOV.
The bill cannot be defined in both Engineering and Manufacturing. Try querying the bill using the Bill Define form in an Engineering responsibility if trying to define the bill in a Manufacturing responsibility or vice-versa. If the bill is defined in Engineering, it can be transferred to Manufacturing if needed.
If the bill is being created in a Manufacturing responsibility, the item cannot be an engineering item.
The EAM_TYPE parameter** must be NULL or if defined with a value of 1 or 2, it must equal the item's EAM_ITEM_TYPE
The UNIT_EFF_FLAG parameter** must be 'Y' or if defined with a value of 'N', the item's
Effectivity Control attribute must be set to 'Date' (1)
 

**The EAM_TYPE and UNIT_EFF_FLAG parameters are passed to the form when opened.
To view their values, perform the following actions:
Using the responsibility and instance where you get the error, open the Bill Define form (Navigate: Bills > Bills)
Choose the Help > Diagnostics > Examine pull down menu option (you will need access to do this)
In the field labeled "Block", use the LOV to choose "PARAMETER"
In the field labeled "Field", enter a parameter name to see its value (either EAM_TYPE or UNIT_EFF_FLAG)
After entering, its defined value will display in the "Value" field
APP-FND-01048.Solution: Check each of the restrictions listed above. If any of them are not met, the item in question cannot be used to define a bill in the current organization.

query1: Check if the item exists in the current organization
SELECT * FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND inventory_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id;
query2: Check if the item is BOM Enabled
SELECT bom_enabled_flag FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND inventory_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id;
query3: Check the BOM Item Type attribute of the item
SELECT bom_item_type FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND inventory_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id;
query4: Check if the item is excluded in OPM enabled organizations (for Model and Option Class)
SELECT * FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND inventory_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id AND bom_item_type IN (1, 2);
query5: Check if the bill is defined in both Engineering and Manufacturing
SELECT * FROM bom.bom_bill_of_materials WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND assembly_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id;
query6: Check the EAM_TYPE and UNIT_EFF_FLAG parameters
SELECT parameter_name, parameter_value FROM fnd_profile_options WHERE profile_option_name IN ('EAM_TYPE', 'UNIT_EFF_FLAG');
query7: Check the value of EAM_TYPE for the given item
SELECT eam_item_type FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND inventory_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id;
query8: Check the Effectivity Control attribute for the item
SELECT effectivity_control FROM inv.mtl_system_items_b WHERE organization_id = :parameter.org_id AND inventory_item_id = :parameter.inventory_item_id;

APP-BOM-20516.Applies To:
Oracle Bills of Material - Version 12.0.4 and later
Information in this document applies to any platform.
WIP Discrete job
APP-BOM-20516.Symptoms:
A WIP discrete job cannot be updated and saved without getting the error APP-BOM-20516:

ERROR
-----------------------
APP-BOM-20516: Item XYZ has no valid revision on (ABC Date i.e. 07-JUL-2010).

STEPS
-----------------------
The issue can be reproduced at will with the following steps:
1. WIP>DISCRETE JOBS>DISCRETE JOBS Open discrete job
try to update and save, get the error
APP-BOM-20516.Cause:
Get the Item id for and the org id for and run the following queries:

1) SELECT * FROM MTL_ITEM_REVISIONS_B MIR
WHERE INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;

2) SELECT *
FROM MTL_RTG_ITEM_REVISIONS
WHERE INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;

Next, check if the item has a routing:

3) SELECT *
FROM BOM_OPERATIONAL_ROUTINGS
WHERE ASSEMBLY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;


If the assembly has a routing, please check that a routing revision record
exists for the assembly. Run the SQL query:

4) SELECT *
FROM MTL_RTG_ITEM_REVISIONS
WHERE INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;
APP-BOM-20516.Solution:
The error that the customer is seeing is a valid error:
APP-BOM-20516: Item XYZ has no valid revision on 07-JUL-2010.

i.e.The routing revision for this item was effective on 12-JUL-2010 based on output of queries 3) and 4) above. 

Hence, for this example on 07-JUL-2010, Item XYZ has no valid revision.

This error is been rendered by the system because the Discrete Job was created on 07-JUL-2010, when there was no routing revision for the Item, based on table information.

In test instance, create a new WIP Discrete Job and save. There will be no error thrown.

Please test deleting the WIP discrete job that is causing the issue, progress to production environment as needed.

query1: Check Item Revisions
query2: Check Routing Item Revisions

SELECT *
FROM MTL_RTG_ITEM_REVISIONS
WHERE INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;
query3: Check Operational Routings

SELECT *
FROM BOM_OPERATIONAL_ROUTINGS
WHERE ASSEMBLY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;
query4: Check Routing Revision Records

SELECT *
FROM MTL_RTG_ITEM_REVISIONS
WHERE INVENTORY_ITEM_ID = &item_id
AND ORGANIZATION_ID = &org_id;

ORA-01403.Applies To:
Oracle Work in Process - Version 12.1.3 to 12.1.3 [Release 12.1]
Information in this document applies to any platform.
ORA-01403.Symptoms:
When attempting to perform Component pick release, the following error occurs.

ERROR

An unexpected error was encountered: wip_picking_pvt.allocate: ORA-01403: no data found STEPS TO REPRODUCE
1.Create Non Standard WIP Job.
2.Component pick release.
3.Increase the quantity of 1 component in the assembly item.
4.Component pick release.
ORA-01403.Solution:
To implement the solution, please execute the following steps:

1. Download and review the readme and pre-requisites for Patch.28650962:R12.WIP.B - COMPONENT PICK RELEASE ERROR: WIP_PICKING_PVT.ALLOCATE ORA-0140

2. Ensure that you have taken a backup of your system before applying the recommended patch.

3. Apply the patch in a test environment.

4. Confirm the following file versions:
  wippckvb.pls 120.18.12010000.34


You can use the commands like the following:

  SELECT name, text FROM dba_source
  WHERE name LIKE UPPER('%wip_picking_pvt%')
  AND UPPER(text) LIKE '%$HEADER%'
  AND line < 7;

5. Retest the issue.

6. Migrate the solution as appropriate to other environments.

query1: Check if the mentioned bug patch is installed
SELECT * FROM dba_registry_sqlpatch WHERE patch_id = '28650962';
query2: Verify the current version of the wippckvb.pls file
SELECT * FROM all_objects WHERE object_name = 'wippckvb.pls';
query3: Examine the source code for the wip_picking_pvt package
SELECT name, text FROM dba_source WHERE name LIKE UPPER('%wip_picking_pvt%') AND UPPER(text) LIKE '%$HEADER%' AND line < 7;
query4: Check for pending or failed transactions related to WIP jobs
SELECT * FROM wip_job_interface WHERE status IN ('P', 'F');
query5: Review WIP job and component details
SELECT * FROM wip_jobs WHERE job_id = (SELECT job_id FROM wip_job_interface WHERE status IN ('P', 'F') AND ROWNUM = 1);
SELECT * FROM wip_components WHERE job_id = (SELECT job_id FROM wip_job_interface WHERE status IN ('P', 'F') AND ROWNUM = 1);
query6: Check for pending resource or material transactions
SELECT * FROM wip_resource_txns WHERE job_id = (SELECT job_id FROM wip_job_interface WHERE status IN ('P', 'F') AND ROWNUM = 1);
SELECT * FROM wip_material_txns WHERE job_id = (SELECT job_id FROM wip_job_interface WHERE status IN ('P', 'F') AND ROWNUM = 1);
query7: Verify the existence of the mentioned patch in the database
SELECT * FROM ad_applied_patches WHERE patch_id = '28650962';
